com.pwn9.filter.minecraft.util

Class ColoredString

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pwn9.filter.minecraft.util.ColoredString
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    EnhancedString, CharSequence

    public final class ColoredString
extends Object
implements EnhancedString
    This object is used to provide a mechanism for running regex match and replacements on a string that may have Color Codes and formats (eg: &5&k) embedded in it. NOTE: By default, this object works on the ampersand (&) character, but this can be specified in the constructor. Any valid format code will be removed from the string for matching purposes.

    Example String: raw: The quick &4brown fox &1&kj&2u&3m&4p&5e&6d over&7 the lazy &ldog. plain: The quick brown fox jumped over the lazy dog codes: {,,,,,,,,,,&4,,,,,,,,,&1&k,&2,&3,&4,&5,&6,,,,,&7,,,,,,,,,&l,,,}

    The codes array maps codes to the character following it. In the example above, plain[10] = 'b', codes[10] = "&4"

    In any string modification action, the codes will be updated to reflect the new string.

    Version:
    $Id: $Id
    Author:
    Sage905

      • replaceText

        public ColoredString replaceText(Pattern p,
                                 String rText)
        Replace all occurrences of Regex pattern with replacement String. If the replacement string has codes embedded, separate them and add them to the code array.

        This is a tricky bit of code. We will copy the last code before a replacement and prepend it to the next code of the current text. If the current text is done, we'll prepend the last code at the end of the replacement text to the last code of the final string. Example: Test &1foo replace foo with bar: Test &1bar replace bar with baz&2: Test &1baz&2 replace baz with nothing: Test &1&2

        Specified by:
        replaceText in interface EnhancedString
        Parameters:
        p - Regex Pattern
        rText - Replacement Text
        Returns:
        a ColoredString object.
